caption: Excellent and yummy food, I liked the atmosphere the place has, and the cashiers were helpful. Will surely come back again.
I loved this place me and fiance went here to celebrate valentinea day. We stayed at the hotel as well. The staff was so friendly. I would recommend everyime to eat here.
The food and service here are simply okay. I have come here more than once because of its proximity to the Kennedy Center, but things were very mediocre, especially considering the price.
Good food, nice wine, great deal on parking near the Kennedy Center. Intimate, not overly formal atmosphere, welcoming to jeans or opera garb.
Fantastic spot tucked away on this street. Carlos, Reilly, and the team were wonderful as was the food. Cant wait to come back.

The food was okay, nothing special. The wine prices are high, with no bottle under $50. I got the pasta with chicken. It tasted fresh but the waitress didnt offer any grated cheese for the top and the tomato sauce was thin.

A lovely boutique restaurant with a superb restaurateur (Carlo!). Attracts an eclectic crowd and serves a variety of dishes including a fabulous roasted black bean quinoa bowl (healthy, plant based) paired with wonderful wine.
Hidden away in The River Inn, it has a diverse menu with well priced and presented selections. Worth finding for drinks and a good tasty meal.
This place just serves top notch food
Fantastic little restaurant very close to the Kennedy Center. They have a 3 course pre-fixe menu before the show and their food is delicious! Try the steak.

Sat at the bar for the 3-course $45 dinner, and loved every single thing! The bartender was awesome, knows a lot about the wines--he does the wine ordering--so we lucked out since we are big wine people! He introduced this Pecorino to us, and it went well with my Gazpacho! I have to mention to Apple Beignet with Caramel Gelato, it was ridiculously good! The Skirt Steak with Bernaise was very solid, too!
The food was excellent and the wait staff was extraordinarily friendly and conversational. Highly recommend the Flourless Chocolate Cake dessert!
Good food.  Good service.  Great neighborhood restaurant.
Excellent service, intimate atmosphere, great wine!
(Translated by Google) Excellent meat, kind and friendly service !! Recommended.  (Original) Carne ottima, servizio gentile ed amichevole!! Consigliato.
Food was very good.  Service seemed a bit slow at times for our group of 8.  Medium rare burger was served medium well.  Shrimp and grits were excellent.
Well executed standard American fare in a quiet setting. Easy access to the Kennedy Center.
Good.  Service a bit slow.  But good.

The food was delicious. I recommend the scallops w/saffron risotto. My husband, had the jumbo lump crabcake w/ succotash and loved it. The bartender had fabulous drink recommendations. Although the restaurant  is small it is what my nniece likes to say "cute and fancy" with  a nice ambiance.
Wonderful restaurant. Personal friendly staff. Very accommodating to our children. Food was delicious and good quality.
Good food, great service, close to the Ken Cen.
Excellent pasta and fab wines from South  Africa, New Zealand, & Walla walla, Tri-Cities Washington...Carlos is welcoming host!!
A little pricey, but decent food and situated close enough to the Kennedy Center to walk to a show.
Excellent

Myself and my friend went there yesterday night for dinner and I can confidently say they are the reason we will be returning to DC again. Carlos our waiter is an amazing person, very attentive and knew what we needed. We celebrated my friends birthday a bit early and they made us feel like we were at home with our families celebrating. Manager is great and greeted all of the tables that evening. Food was delicious and came out in a timely manner, we will be back for more.
Great food...great service...quaint and a perfect pre fixe before the Kennedy Center.
Delicious as always!
Easy walk to Kennedy Center. Service was good and the food was good. The pre-show three course was way more food than I could eat.
Great service, great food, and out in time for the Kenedy Center shows.
A great little place, everything was prepared excellent and the service was fantastic.
Great food, fantastic service and helpful staff!  Always learning about new wines here!

We reserved a table for a before the theatre dinner. Pros: Good portion size, salmon was great, parking was awesome (valet was convenient and cheap)  Cons: fixed theatre menu price differed on Google, River Inn website, and night of ($35, $40, $45) respectively. Atmosphere was chaotic, waitstaff inattentive, overbooked reservations, pasta dish very mediocre, soda/coffee $5.  Meal and experience not worth the $110.
Delicious food, and Keith is an amazing server. The risotto is excellent, and I loved the cheese board too. I will be back!
Very intimate dining experience
Nothing bad I can say about this place. This place is truly amazing. Great food and service.
Great little spot!

Dish + Drinks is a excellent restaurant. Carlos and his staff make you feel like the only people in the place. He took time to suggest a wine and even gave us a few samples. The food and atmosphere are great. The price  was very reasonable for a restaurant of it caliber
Such a cool, quiet neighborhood bar.  Carlos can create a wicked good cocktail.
Hidden gem
(Translated by Google) Super welcome! Very clean and well located.  (Original) Super accueil ! Très propre et bien situé.

Popular spot for dinner and drinks before a show at the Kennedy Center. Food is decent.    Small place tucked in off the lobby of a boutique hotel. Whomever made rhe decision about design seems to have a thing for dogs, specifically Great Danes or a breed that looks similar. Srevice was really good and food came out in good time.
Great place
Nice little neighborhood gem. Cozy modern ambience, friendly service, well prepared food, reasonably priced.
Best restaurant in Foggy Bottom. The culinary expertise is the best, delicious and sensible priced.
Food was simple, yet good and fresh. The staff attentive and nice.

The poor reviews here are amusing. Treat the wait staff like human beings and you will be treated like family, which is not a bad deal. If you care about what you consume, whether that is food, drink, or conversation this is the place for you. The people who work here are intelligent, passionate, and invested in their work. It shows. I can recommend the fish (any of the fish) and what ever the bartender Keith suggests you drink with it. Friday nights can be busy, if you want a quiet evening try something in the middle of the week.

I stayed at the River Inn for 4 nights, I walked into the Dish restaurant for dinner on one of the nights, I waited by the “wait here to be seated” sign for a while watching the waiters and waitresses glance at me and glance away, after about 5 minutes I walked out and went somewhere else, I had an amazing meal at the District Commons around the corner. On the last day I dutifully stood by that same sign in full view of one waiter, and one waitress tending to a table each for what would have been well over 5 minutes. Once again being looked at constantly but not aknowleged, I left and went into Georgetown and had a nice breakfast at Le Pain Quotidien, I reccomend doing the same.
Fantastic food.  Staff is excellent.   Wine list quite sxtensive for smaller restuarant.   The chocolate souffle is a very nice ending.  Don't miss this wonderful dining experience.

Keith the manager is fantastic! A small dining area but great food! The calamari was perfect, the salad was great and the salmon over lentils melted in your mouth! Drinks from the bar were very potent. My husband thoroughly enjoyed their German beer. A great experience while here for the inauguration.

Staff is amazing and the food is some of the best I have ever had. Having sampled dishes from breakfast, lunch and dinner it is safe to say this place is superb! The staff are so friendly and welcoming and are easy to converse with which makes the meal that much better with a personal touch. The chefs know what they are doing in the kitchen I have not had an issue with a single dish I have had from Dish. It is a smaller restaurant which is perfect for pre-theatre dinners, date night or just a casual night out with friends. The bar is fully stocked and the drinks are strong, so even if you are not in the mood for a meal you can always come and grab a drink at the bar.
Scallops and rissoto were nothing short of heavenly! Great and friendly staff. A delicious must!

If I was able I would eat here every day for the rest of my trip to DC. I had the scallops and risotto tonight. Hands down, this was the best risotto I have ever had in my life. It was perfectly tender, creamy, flavorful...awesome. The scallops were also perfectly prepared. We finished with the creme brulee that had that perfectly carmelized crust of sugar on the top that you broke open with your spoon. Yummmmm. Also thanks Keith for the great conversation and helping us decide what to try. Great place...do not miss it.

Small, cozy place tucked inside the River Inn.  There is a small bar and fireplace that makes the place warm & inviting.  We sat at a small table by the window with a nice view of 25th Street.  The menu isn't extensive with prices typical for DC.  We started with the spring rolls which were very tasty.  Our main dishes were the scallops and tuna tartare.  The scallops dish was a little light on the portions with only 4 scallops, while the portions for the tuna tartare dish were just right for my date.  The manager or owner named Keith came around to check on us and engaged us in some polite small talk.  He was seeking a partner for a fishing weekend in NJ and overheard me talking to my date about swordfish.  Very nice guy.  Our waitress was utterly efficient and polite as well.  We had a very pleasant experience.  Definitely recommend.

Wonderful food, great service, cozy atmosphere. Waiters know your name after two visits. This place is home for Foggy Bottom residents, especially when you need one of Keith's famous Cosmos after a long day. Food is excellent and desserts are heavenly.
My wife and I stopped in during our visit to DC for a quick lunch.  The crab cake sandwich and burger we fantastic.   Service was good.  Nice William Wegman photos know the wall.

Lackluster. I was super excited from the menu as it had several options that peeked my interest and I found it difficult to select. However the actual palate experience was overall disappointing. The duck spring rolls were good. However the fried green tomato tasted like fried thick breading with a very bland sauce on top. The salmon entree did not work at all. Bacon and salmon should not be served together in the same dish. Both are fatty and there was nothing in the dish to balance this out. The smoked bacon overpowered the delicate flavor of the salmon and everything else in the dish. The service was good and they were very attentive in getting us served in time to see our show at the Kennedy Center.  They had nice options but need to work on the delivery for the taste buds.

Ended up here after first place we stopped was full and suggested we go around the corner. We were very pleasantly surprised. Our salads were good, both main dishes were excellent (scallops w/ risotto & salmon) and the dessert was also excellent (apple cinnamon thingy). Staff was attentive but not overbearing and very helpful and pleasant. Will definitely go again.
